info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 26 at 1:57PM MDT until March 27 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Rapid City SD
info.description:
...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS NORTHEASTERN WYOMING...
.Dry southwesterly flow is expected Thursday with temperatures warming into the mid 70s across northeastern Wyoming. Relative humidity will fall into the low teens along with southwesterly winds with gusts up to 30 mph. These conditions may result in critical fire weather conditions through the afternoon Thursday.
The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect Thursday afternoon.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains and 317 Weston County Plains.
* WINDS...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent.
* IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

parameter.value: FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, AND 317

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Crook County Plains; Weston County Plains
